content: What is the expected syntax for filter parameters with logical OR combination? The spec: "allowing for search conditions (and / or / exclusions)" is rather unclear.
filters in an include are AND. multiple includes are OR

I think what @Simone Heckmann asked is the filter parameter in $expand operation. The same section states that "The server can document the way this parameter works in TerminologyCapabilities..expansion.textFilter." The default composite OR search parameter should apply here if server supports. 

$expand?filter=headache,backpain
@Yunwei Wang : that was the original background of the question. We assumed that the comma-separated OR syntax would apply here too, but we werenâ€™t sure.
I would strongly recommend against embedding syntax into your implementation of the filter parameter
I use the SQL Server text format in test.fhir.org, actually
oh no. not in that place. I just do left root matching using stems of the words

For example, the following are SNOMED terms that would not play well with interpreting , as OR:

Abrasion, hip
Abrasion, toe
Tumor, benign
Wound, closed
Wound, healed
Wound, recent
